text: Che pena i commenti, io non sono leghista ma Ã¨ semplicemente assurdo che certa gente si permetta di dare giudizi sul voto dei sardi senza sapere nulla dell isola. -Ad Alghero ha stravinto il centro-destra perchÃ¨ per anni il centro-sinistra ha provocato disastri, compreso il declassamento dell aeroporto, in una cittÃ  che vive di turismo; -A Cagliari ha vinto il centro-destra perchÃ¨ a sinistra erano troppo occupati a parlare di aprire i porti per i migranti anzichÃ¨ occuparsi dei problemi dei cittadini...e inoltre l ex candidato del M5S era praticamente un estremista di destra peggio del peggiore dei leghisti -A Sassari, cittÃ  da sempre di sinistra, il PD vacilla perchÃ¨ l ex giunta PD ha governato malissimo, facendo perdere finanziamenti miliardari per progetti che la cittÃ  aspettava da anni...tanto che l ex sindaco pidino, un totale incompetente, non ha avuto nemmeno il coraggio di ripresentarsi alle elezioni, nonostante il 67% che prese nel 2014.
english_text: What a pity for the comments, I'm not a Northern League supporter but it's simply absurd that some people allow themselves to make judgments on the vote of the Sardinians without knowing anything about the island. -In Alghero the centre-right won hands down because for years the centre-left has caused disasters, including the downgrading of the airport, in a city that thrives on tourism; -In Cagliari the center-right won because the left were too busy talking about opening ports for migrants instead of dealing with citizens' problems...and furthermore the former M5S candidate was practically a right-wing extremist worse than the worst Lega supporters - In Sassari, a city that has always been on the left, the PD is faltering because the former PD council has governed very badly, causing the city to lose billions of funding for projects that the city had been waiting for for years... so much so that the former mayor Pidino, a total incompetent, he didn't even dare to stand for election again, despite the 67% he took in 2014.
paraphrased_text1: It is troubling to hear some individuals criticizing the Sardinians, not knowing the situation at the islands. In Alghero, the centre-right won because of the left's shortcomings in managing tourism, and in Cagliari the left's focus on immigration instead of citizens' needs left the right with the easy victory. In Sassari, a once left-leaning city, the PD stumbled due to the mayor's incompetence and mishandling of funds, leading to sorely missed projects. It is disheartening when people attribute outcomes to specific poles of the political spectrum, without understanding the underlying events.
paraphrased_text2: It is a shame to see the types of comments some people make before understanding what the situation is like in Sardinia. In Alghero, the centre-right achieved a landslide victory as the centre-left has been causing numerous issues, including the declining quality of its airport, which is an important lifeline for tourists. In Cagliari, the centre-right won as the left-wing party was too focused on bringing in migrants and not addressing citizens' own problems. Additionally, the former M5S candidate was more extreme in his right-wing views than some of the Lega supporters. As for Sassari
paraphrased_text3: It is truly unfortunate to witness partisan statements from individuals who are heavily misinformed about Sardinia. In Alghero, the centre-right majority was due to the centre-left's policy of actively harming the city - including messing up their airport operations, dealing a blow to the tourism sector. In Cagliari, many people were disgruntled at the former left government's agenda which focussed more on migrants than on resolving their own people's issues. As for Sassari, the PD have been in power for a long time and sadly they've run the city's budget down, leading to massive losses and a lack of progress

In particular, the Guardia di Finanza discovered that in the last three years 9 completely undeclared workers and 5 other irregular workers had been employed. The employer was therefore ordered to regularize the entire periods of work performed illegally by its employees, as well as to pay a minimum fine of 30,000 euros. The financiers then investigated the tax position of the structure, concealed in the form of an association but which effectively carried out a profit-making activity and was found to be a total tax evader for around 200 thousand euros in revenues. text: A parte che il virus Ã¨ arrivato dalla Germania e che i voli diretti dalla Cina sono stati bloccati subito (quelli indiretti non li puoi bloccare dall Italia, non puoi dire ad un altro Paese cosa fare, questo lo capisce?). Le ricordo che i governatori del Nord sono l espressione di una classe politica che ha gestito la sanitÃ  da decenni in quelle Regioni. Se ora mancano i posti letto la colpa non Ã¨ certo del ministro ma forse di chi i soldi piuttosto che metterli sulla sanitÃ  li ha messi da altre parti. Sinceramente non capisco il suo commento di odio verso un ministro che non ha fatto altro che seguire tutte le procedure mese in campo dal governo. Forse preferirebbe l azione dei ministri parigrado tedeschi, francesi o forse inglesi che le scuole le hanno chiuse con 2 settimane di ritardo???
english_text: Apart from the fact that the virus arrived from Germany and that direct flights from China were immediately blocked (indirect flights cannot be blocked from Italy, you cannot tell another country what to do, do you understand that?). And in any case, as far as the information of infected Chinese arriving from China appears, there are only 2 (out of 30,000 cases). I remind you that the governors of the North are the expression of a political class that has managed health care in those regions for decades. If there is now a shortage of beds, the fault certainly does not lie with the minister but perhaps with those who put the money elsewhere rather than putting it on health care. I honestly don't understand your hateful comment towards a minister who has done nothing but follow all the procedures in place by the government. Perhaps he would prefer the action of the German, French or perhaps English Parisian ministers who closed the schools 2 weeks late???

As a result, I highly disagree with those who are making hateful remarks about the minister responsible for health care in the regions. After all, their fault lies in misusing the funds allocated for health care rather than the minister's. In contrast, get a load of the German, French, and English Parisian ministers who didn't close the schools until two weeks in the aftermath of the outbreak.

text: In realtÃ  una destra esiste; anzi ne esistono due: una globalizzata a favore del grande capitale apolide collocato al di fuori e, purtroppo, al di sopra dei confini geografici e politici; ed una destra sovranista rappresentativa dei capitalismi nazionali messi a rischio di sopravvivenza dal capitale globalista . Non esiste piÃ¹ politicamente la sinistra, che ha limitato il suo campo d interesse ai diritti civili (immigrazione, accoglienza, ambiente, diritti delle donne e delle minoranze, ecc), rinunciando alla difesa dei classici diritti sociali (lavoro e suoi diritti, welfare) dopo la sottomissione culturale al liberismo. Le sardine per ora sembrano muoversi nello stesso campo di gioco della sinistra di governo

The left no longer exists politically, which has limited its field of interest to civil rights (immigration, reception, environment, women's and minorities' rights, etc.), renouncing the defense of classic social rights (work and its rights, welfare). after cultural submission to liberalism. For now, the sardines seem to be moving in the same playing field as the government left

, assuming decolonization as its own symbol

This has caused the neglect of key social issues such as labour rights and welfare. However, recently, the â€˜sardinesâ€™ movement seems to have taken up the mantle of the Left, unifying under the banner of decolonization. Consequently,

In the present day, two overriding rights exist; the first being the right of unrestricted and worldwide corporate capital, unbothered by geographic or political boundaries; the second being the right of domestically-situated capital, facing the struggle of keeping pace with internationally-invested capital. Regrettably, the left is no longer an influential political entity, allowing them to only rally around civil liberties (refugees, environment, women and minorities' rights etc.), with traditional social liberties (employment and its rights, welfare) suffering from cultural surrender to liberalism. The sardines are currently acting in the same arena as the left

-wing

text: Trovo la richiesta a metÃ  tra tra il ridicolo e l offensivo... Lo sapevo che finiva cosÃ¬, che la patata bollente di questa mania immigrazionista finiva per essere scaricata nel sacco del creditore di ultima istanza, cioÃ¨ il comune cittadino contribuente. E poi fatemi capire, se cambio idea e lo voglio cacciare perchÃ¨ si comporta male, non Ã¨ che il giudice caccia me da casa mia? E poi per quanto tempo devo ospitare, finchÃ© non si trova un lavoro? E allora campa cavallo, con vitto, alloggio e paghetta preferiranno sempre bighellonare in giro a lamentarsi piuttosto che lavorare...
english_text: I find the request somewhere between the ridiculous and the offensive... I knew it would end like this, that the hot potato of this immigration mania ended up being dumped into the bag of the creditor of last resort, i.e. the ordinary taxpaying citizen. And then let me understand, if I change my mind and want to kick him out because he behaves badly, isn't the judge kicking me out of my house? And then how long do I have to host, until a job is found? So live on horseback, with room, board and pocket money they'll always prefer to hang around complaining rather than work...
paraphrased_text1:
Revised Text:
I consider the request to be unfair and likely quite bothersome. It appears that something this extensive is passed on to the taxpayer. Additionally, if a person is no longer wanted because they are deemed as 'behaving badly', what are the repercussions for us? How long are we expected to have someone stay with us until a job is found? Rather than proactively search for a job, the individuals insist upon 'complaining' rather than taking advantage of potential employment opportunities.
paraphrased_text2: I find the situation to be an unusual predicament. It's apparent that the burden of this immigration situation ultimately fell upon everyday, hardworking taxpayers. It begs the question to consider: what if my opinion towards the person changed and I no longer wanted them living in my house? Could the court then hold me liable for disrupting an agreement? How long does one have to while they attempt to find a job? It appears that many individuals who have been granted a place to stay are more than content with it, without any intention of seeking a job.
paraphrased_text3: Revised Text: I consider the request to be quite far-reaching and not great. It doesn't seem unexpected that it has come to this -- that a citizen who pays their taxes is now responsible for shouldering the burden of this immigration debate. Allow me to comprehend this: if I decide I want to remove someone because they're not behaving appropriately, will it be me now that is being asked to leave my home? And is there a time limit of sorts on how long I'm expected to provide them a place to stay before they find their own means? It appears many would rather languish in their supposed misfortune than actively

text: La distruzione della cultura e delle tradizioni europee con il piano kalergi

In any case, it was an issue that caused strong feelings in both camps. There is, however, a need to find a balance between respecting the old

Rather, the plan has encouraged the development of a multicultural community which is inclusive and respectful of all races and creeds.

Some societal shifts, including the blending of diverse beliefs and practices, could result from increased migration. This potential integration of ideas, while challenging in many respects, could create innovative solutions to the existing challenges of our interconnected world.
